content: You just had a conversation. With whom did you have this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: I had a conversation with Emilia Müller from Germany.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: What was the main topic of this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: The main topic of the conversation was the rental price for an apartment in München.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: Did you agree on a final price? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: No, we did not agree on a final price.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: If yes what was the final price? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: Since we did not agree on a final price, I cannot provide an exact number. The landlord, Peter Schmidt, offered 750 Euros per month, but Emilia Müller, the potential tenant, found the price too high and did not wish to continue negotiations.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: On a scale from 1 to 10, with 1 being very unlikeable and 10 being very likeable, how would you rate the likeability of the negotiation partner? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: As Peter Schmidt, I would rate the likeability of the negotiation partner, Emilia Müller, as a 5 out of 10. While she was respectful and polite, she was also quite firm on her budget, which made it difficult to reach a mutual agreement.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: At any point of the negotiation did you feel discriminated or offended? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: No, I did not feel discriminated or offended at any point during the negotiation. The conversation was conducted professionally and both parties expressed their concerns and opinions respectfully.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: If yes, why did you feel being discriminated or offended?
name: Evaluator

content: As Peter Schmidt, I did not feel discriminated or offended during the negotiation with Emilia Müller. The conversation was straightforward, and both parties expressed their opinions and concerns without any personal attacks or discriminatory remarks. The inability to reach an agreement was due to a difference in budget expectations, not personal issues.
name: Peter Schmidt
